summary: R&B is a music genre that started in African-American communities in the 1940s. It was first used to describe music with a strong beat, often played by a band with guitars, piano, and saxophones. The lyrics often tell stories about African-American life, including struggles and happiness. Over time, R&B changed and mixed with other music styles like soul, funk, and hip-hop. In the 1980s, a new type of R&B called "contemporary R&B" became popular, blending many music genres.
title: Rhythm and blues
